intro.description:
A sequence organizes information in order to realize the final XML. It is namely this which will call the transactions.
The text in bold in this help file is available in (?).

item.title: First project (22)
item.description: In this part you will create a sequence which will construct the final XML and compare multiple word searches.

item.title: Create a new sequence
item.description:
In the tab Projects view right click your project next press on :
>New
>Sequence
>Generic sequence
>Next
>Finish

item.title: First project (23)
item.description:
>Call your sequence "constructXML".
Your sequence will have as argument two phrases which will be handled by google and compared by Convertigo.
>To create them, click on sequence then on the propriaty "Variables" next on "...".
>Press two times on the blue icon of the pop-up which appears name the first variable "word1" and the second "word2" and assign default values for them.

item.title: Create steps
item.description:
Multiple instructions are available for the sequences: these are steps (available in (?)).
To add a stepto a sequence right click on the sequence next press on "new" next on "Step"

item.title: First project (24)
item.description:
Start by transforming your Javascript variables to XML variables.
>To do this you have to create two steps "jElement" in which you will place "word1" and "word2" in the propriaty "Expression"
Ces variables sont des valeurs auxiliaires que l'on ne veut pas retrouver dans le résultat final.
> Pour que ce soit le cas cliquez sur chacun de ces steps et mettez leur proprieté "Output" à la valeur false.

item.title: First project (25)
item.description:
Now call the transaction "getData" for each of the phrases to be treated.
>Create two steps "Call Transaction".
>Choose the transaction "getData" in the propriaty "Transaction" of each of the steps.
>Right click on the steps "call transaction" and click on "Import WSDL from traject transaction" (If this does not work reverify l' step 21 )
>Right click on the steps "call transaction" and click on "Import variables from traject transaction"
>Click on the "..." of the propriaties "variables" of the steps call transaction (wordToAnalyse is present). Click on "..." of the propriaty "Source", next on the button "New Source" next on one of the steps "jElement" created in step 24 (different by transaction).

item.title: First project (26)
item.description:
>Create a step"Complex" englobing the results of a google search.
>Faites un clic droit sur ce step "Complex" et faite "new" --> "Step" --> "Element"
>Assign the propriaty "Node name" to the value "wordSearch"
>Click on "..." of the propriaty "Source",next on "New Source" and choose the step "jelement" containing "word1"

item.title: First project (27)
item.description:
>Right click on the step of type "Complex" and do "new" --> "Step" --> "Transform": this step transforms a chain of characters
>Put the propriaty "Node name"(of the Transform step) to the value "nbAnswers"
>Click on "..." of the propriaty "Source",then on "New Source". Click on step "Call Transactiont" which treats the first word and choose on the right screen the value "XMLText" which is appearing.
>Click on "..." of the propriaty "Replacement". Create two lines in this form with the blue button.
The column "Regular exp" corresponds to a chain of characters present in the source which we will replace with the value "Replacement". "Regular exp" can be written thans to the regular expressions of which the semantic is present in (?).
>Put "(.*)about " in the column "Replacement" of one of the lines and " for(.*)" in l' another.

item.title: First project (28)
item.description:
>Right click on the step of type "Complex" and do "new" --> "Step" --> "Iterator": this step will execute all of the instructions which it contains once for each element in the parameter "Source",
>Click on "..." of the propriaty "Source",then on "New Source" then click on the step "Call Transaction" which will treat the first word and choose on the right screen the value "XMLRecord" which appears.

item.title: First project (29)
item.description:
>Right click on the step of type "Iterator" and do "new" --> "Step" --> "Element"
>Put the propriaty "Node name"(of the Element step) to the value "title"
>Click on "..." of the propriaty "Source", then on "New Source" then click on step "Iterator" choose on the right the value "title" under "XMLRecord".

item.title: First project (30)
item.description:
>Right click on the step of type "Iterator" and do "new" --> "Step" --> "Element"
>Put the propriaty "Node name"(of step Element) to the value "adress"
>Click on "..." of the propriaty "Source",on "New Source" then click on step "Iterator" choose on the right screen the value "adress" under the "XMLRecord".

item.title: First project (31)
item.description: Restart from step 26 for the second word.

item.title: Test your sequences
item.description:
To test a sequence, double click on the sequence (a new window connector view appears).
Right click on séquence then press on "Execute".
The result is in the tab Output Tag of the browser area

item.title: add a style sheet (optional)
item.description:
You can transform your XML into HTML code Thanks to the XSL sheet
>Put the propriaty "Style sheet" of the sequence to the value "from sequence"
> Right click on sequence,press on "New" then on "Sheet" and finally on "XSL style sheet".
>In the propriaty "URL" of this sheet write a file name followed by the extension ".xsl"
>In the view "Project Explorer view ", right click on on the directory of your project, click on "New", on "File" and put the name there entered in "URL".
>Finally writhe your XSL code in the file
Le résultat sera dans l'onglet "Browser" de la Connector view
